wings page 4 of 4 tunisian mosaic crochet key us terminology single_crochet = tss refer to page 2 key for more terms the terms below are ones we are changing when we translate things to tunisian mosaic crochet double_crochet = either a modified pftdc front post extended tunisian crochet or a modified fpetc front post tunisian double_crochet modified fpetc = insert hook around front and back leg of stitch 2 row below yarn over and pull up a loop chain 1 modified fptdc = yarn over and insert hook around front and back leg of stitch 2 row double_crochet = modified pfetc below yarn over and pull up a loop yarn over and pull through 2 loops on your hook es = end stitch insert hook under both loops of the upside-down v pull up a loop then do the return pass fsc = chain as many as the stitch count given here then pick up a loop through each chain skip the turning chain your open loops on the hook should now match the stitch count given then do a return pass js = the first loop on your hook after making each row s color change return pass = yarn over and pull through one loop then *yarn over and pull through two loops* repeat between the asterisks * until there are only two loops left on your hook change colors double_crochet = modified pftdc single_crochet = tss tunisian simple crochet tunisian simple crochet = insert hook into front leg of stitch pull up a loop brackets are used in the written pattern to indicate repeated sections see my detailed explanation https //ashleeslint com/2020/08/29/brackets-in-crochet-patterns/ tunisian mosaic crochet technique please see the fpetc tutorial https //youtu be/zzpvhewvz5k or the fptdc tutorial https //youtu be/azanrugdqco for more details each square on the chart corresponds to one stitch there is an additional stitch not visible on the chart on each side of the chart for joining and ending for tunisian we will use these stitches for our color changing stitch and the final edge stitch you start at the bottom-right corner of the chart the front of your work is always facing you this is the right side the side showing the design you are always working from the right to the left opposite for left-handed crocheters yarn colors can be anything you like they need to contrast well try a black and white photo to see if they are too similar they need to be the same weight size/thickness we
